metadata.title: CVE-2015-7837 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The Linux kernel, as used in Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7, kernel-rt, andEnterprise MRG 2 and when booted with UEFI Secure Boot enabled, allowslocal users to bypass intended securelevel/secureboot restrictions byleveraging improper handling of secure_boot flag across kexec reboot.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-7837` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-93-generic - 4.4.0-93.116
linux-image-4.4.0-93-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-93.116
linux-image-4.4.0-93-lowlatency - 4.4.0-93.116
linux-image-4.4.0-93-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-93.116
linux-image-4.4.0-93-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-93.116
linux-image-4.4.0-93-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-93.116
linux-image-4.4.0-93-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-93.116
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-93-generic - 4.4.0-93.116
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1032-aws - 4.4.0-1032.41
No subscription required

linux-image-4.8.0-36-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-4.8.0-36-generic-lpae - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-4.8.0-36-lowlatency - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.8.0-36-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1028-gke - 4.4.0-1028.28
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1028-gke - 4.4.0-1028.28
No subscription required

linux-image-4.11.0-1009-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
linux-image-extra-4.11.0-1009-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-4.10.0-1004-gcp - 4.10.0-1004.4
linux-image-extra-4.10.0-1004-gcp - 4.10.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1007-kvm - 4.4.0-1007.12
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1008-oem - 4.13.0-1008.9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-93.116').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1032.41').
linux-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1').
linux-gke package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1028.28').
linux-azure package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.11.0-1009.9').
linux-gcp package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.10.0-1004.4').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1007.12').
linux-euclid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-oem package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1008.9').
